Backswing [auto] If you miss with this weapon, gain +1 circumstance bonus to hit with your next attack made with this weapon before the end of your turn.

Charge If you moved at least 10 ft on the action before your attack, add a circumstance bonus to damage equal to the number of damage dice for the weapon.
{{/rollGreater() hasCharge 0}} {{#rollGreater() hasDeadly 0}}
Deadly On critical hit, adds 1 damage die of the listed size (2 if using a master quality weapon, or 3 if legendary quality).
{{/rollGreater() hasDeadly 0}} {{#rollGreater() hasDisarm 0}}
Disarm You can use this weapon to Disarm with Athletics without a free hand. Uses this weapon's reach and item bonus to attack rolls for the Disarm attempt. If you critically fail to Disarm, you can drop the weapon to treat it as a normal failure. On critical success, you still need a free hand to take the Disarmed item.
{{/rollGreater() hasDisarm 0}} {{#rollGreater() hasFatal 0}}
Fatal On critical hit, add an extra damage die. Also, all weapon damage dice increase to the listed size.

Finesse You can use Dexterity instead of Strength when making melee attack rolls. You still use Strength when calculating damage.
{{/rollGreater() hasFinesse 0}} {{#rollGreater() hasForceful 0}}
Forceful [auto] On your second attack with this weapon, add a circumstance bonus to damage equal to the number of weapon damage dice. On further attacks, add double this bonus instead.

Free-Hand Does not take up your hand. Cannot be Disarmed. You cannot attack with this weapon if the hand is wielding or being used for something else. Only one free-hand can be equipped weapon per hand.

Nonlethal All attacks with this weapon are nonlethal by default. Lethal attacks are considered untrained.
{{/rollGreater() hasNonlethal 0}} {{#rollGreater() hasParry 0}}

Twin If wielding two of the same weapon with this trait in both hands and you have already attacked with one of them, add a circumstance bonus to damage equal to its number of weapon damage dice. Both weapons must be of the same type, but need not share the same quality or runes.

Weapon Traits
4
Bulk
• + -quality weapon
• range, to hit, multi-attack /
• Deals ( 0d4 + ) + ( 0d4 + ) .

• Runes
Agile Multiple attack penalty with this weapon is -4/-8 instead of -5/-10.
Attached Attached to another piece of gear which must be wielded or worn to use this weapon. Can be removed and attached to another item with a Crafting check. Can be salvaged if the attached gear is destroyed.
Backstabber Deal 1 precision damage when hitting a flat-footed creature (2 if using a master quality weapon, or 3 if legendary quality).
Backswing If you miss with this weapon, gain +1 circumstance bonus to hit with your next attack made with this weapon before the end of your turn.
Charge If you moved at least 10 ft on the action before your attack, add a circumstance bonus to damage equal to the number of damage dice for the weapon.
Deadly On critical hit, adds 1 damage die of the listed size (2 if using a master quality weapon, or 3 if legendary quality).
Disarm You can use this weapon to Disarm with Athletics without a free hand. Uses this weapon's reach and item bonus to attack rolls for the Disarm attempt. If you critically fail to Disarm, you can drop the weapon to treat it as a normal failure. On critical success, you still need a free hand to take the Disarmed item.
Fatal On critical hit, add an extra damage die. Also, all weapon damage dice increase to the listed size.
Finesse You can use Dexterity instead of Strength when making melee attack rolls. You still use Strength when calculating damage.
Forceful On your second attack with this weapon, add a circumstance bonus to damage equal to the number of weapon damage dice. On further attacks, add double this bonus instead.
Free-Hand Does not take up your hand. Cannot be Disarmed. You cannot attack with this weapon if the hand is wielding or being used for something else. Only one free-hand can be equipped weapon per hand.
Nonlethal All attacks with this weapon are nonlethal by default. Lethal attacks are considered untrained.
Parry You can spend an action while wielding this weapon to parry, gaining +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn.
Propulsive Add half your Strength modifier to damage (or your full modifier if it is negative).
Reach Can hit targets up to an additional 5 feet away.
Shove You can use this weapon to Shove with Athletics without a free hand. Use this item's reach and item bonus to attack rolls for the Shove attempt. If you critically fail to Shove, you can drop the weapon to treat it as a normal failure.
Sweep Gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack if you already attacked a different creature with this weapon this turn.
Thrown Can be thrown as a ranged attack. Uses Dexterity to hit and Strength for damage.
Trip You can use this weapon to Trip with Athletics without a free hand. Use this item's reach and item bonus to attack rolls for the Trip attempt. If you critically fail to Trip, you can drop the weapon to treat it as a normal failure.
Twin If wielding two of the same weapon with this trait in both hands and you have already attacked with one of them, add a circumstance bonus to damage equal to its number of weapon damage dice. Both weapons must be of the same type, but need not share the same quality or runes.
Two-Hand When wielded in two hands, increase the damage dice to the listed value. Also applies to extra damage dice from the magic weapon spell.
Unarmed This "weapon" is part of your body and cannot be Disarmed.
Versatile Can deal an alternate type of damage. The damage type is chosen each time you make an attack.
Volley Attacks against targets within the specified distance take a -2 penalty.

Clumsy This armor's Dexterity modifier cap also applies to Reflex saves and to all Dexterity-based skill and ability checks that don't have the attack trait.
Fragile If fragile armor takes a Dent, it is automatically broken.
Noisy This armor's check penalty increases by 1 on Stealth checks.
